meanings.definition: A solemn promise or pledge, especially one made to a deity or a loved one.
meanings.sent1: During the wedding ceremony, they exchanged heartfelt vows of love and commitment.
meanings.sent2: She kept her vows to always cherish and support her best friend.
meanings.sent3: The cat made vows to catch every mouse in the house, but ended up napping instead.
meanings.sent4: The old tree's vows to stand tall and provide shade were evident in its sturdy trunk.
meanings.sent5: His vows to protect the environment were reflected in his daily recycling habits.

meanings.definition: To make a solemn promise or pledge.
meanings.sent1: They vowed to always stand by each other through thick and thin.
meanings.sent2: He vows to work hard and achieve his dreams no matter what obstacles come his way.
meanings.sent3: The little boy vowed to finish his vegetables before having dessert.
meanings.sent4: The captain vowed to steer the ship safely through the stormy seas.
meanings.sent5: She vowed to never give up on her passion for painting, no matter the challenges.
